topic.title: Who do you think will win the UK election?
Inspiring song list
topic.body:
I'll start with this Australian song, which is where I am from: [Bliss n Eso - Moments feat. Gavin James ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yCH7bEbc1Ns) (Clearnet - YouTube)

P.S. I love you all. I hope you're having a wonderful day.

topic.title: World Wide Web Consortium abandons consensus, standardizes DRM with 58.4% support, EFF resigns
[Request] Reddit, for ZeroNet
topic.body: It has been sad news to hear that Reddit will no longer be FLOSS software, so I ask creative people: Can we please get a Reddit clone on ZeroNet? Thanks!

topic.title: New Zealand election
topic.body: Hello my fellow Kiwis, make sure to enrol to vote TODAY if you haven't already. Once you've done that, please either vote today, or tomorrow. The polls are very close, so if you want your party to be elected, you NEED to vote.

topic.title: [New Zealand] Labour and NZ First form coalition, Greens agree to supply and confidence.
topic.body: What an interesting ride, we now have a new government. After 9 years, the Nationals have finally lost in New Zealand's Mixed-Member Proportional electoral system.

2_1GgNo3CmxPd7n2pMSF3uyqf1XHvgtTUqCe.body:
> [fickenccp](#comment_2_15E2Ms8RjnhE2h77ng5GAtVbX3vRxf3PwE): I think will be Tory.

I'm thinking that too, even though she wants to bring austerity, rip up human rights, regulate the internet and so fourth. It looks like Rupert Murdoch has completely destroyed the UK with his mass media outlets. I still will hope that Jeremy Corbyn will pull through.

Okay, the polls will open in 8 minutes. As an Australian, I'd vote for the Pirate Party, but I am not too sure of the UK's political system. If it's similar to the US's, then I'd vote for Labour.  If you're not too sure who you should vote for, quickly take this quiz: https://uk.isidewith.com/en/ (Yes, it may not be 100% correct, but it will give you an idea.)
Okay, the polls are open. Go vote! :D
According to the exit polls, there will be no majority government. If that's true, then boy oh boy did Threasa May blow her 20% lead! This is great news if it's true!
The [ABC](http://www.abc.net.au/)'s election specialist, Anthony Green, is saying the Conservatives will be returned, but will just fall short of a majority.

I'm calling the election: [The Conservatives will be returned, but as a minority government.](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1White24UrrwQrD86o6Vrc1apgZ1x1o51/1GgNo3CmxPd7n2pMSF3uyqf1XHvgtTUqCe/1496978774)

3_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE.body:
TL;DR: ZeroNet is gaining traction in mainland China as it offers freedom and we should welcome them with open arms.

-----

What you're seeing is an increase of people who want freedom from mainland China's authoritarian control. The more Chinese people you see on here, the better. This is because we know that ZeroNet is getting it's message spread across mainland China.

Yes, it can be annoying going through languages you don't understand, but it *is* a good thing. I'm so happy people from mainland China know about this project, and you should be too! ^-^

1_188Uit7FJJgyMWE3yh6934fKSucopDHgDz.body: I have heard from some Chinese people that on ZeroSites, NewGFWTalk is listed in English and not Chinese, so they don't know NewGFWTalk exists.

1_1WeDfuFi18uBne938aNwZDwAuKPMDYQxn.body: While I don't agree that this is an anti-white movement, I do see a huge issue with the censorship that's being normalised. I am a left-wing libertarian from Australia, and I support freedom of speech *and* multiculturalism. This is why we need to innovate by decentralising the internet and start using technologies that use Blockchain (if you meet the requirements (not system specs)) and so fourth. I do not support censorship of any kind.

> [planespherev3](#comment_253_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): Give me one advantage of multiculturalism.

Multiculturalism sets us up for the future. Believe it or not, it's inevitable that we're all going to mix around. With advancing technologies, it has become far, far easier to contact a person from the other side of the planet, then travel to them under a few days. Simply saying multiculturalism will never work is pretty foolish. All it takes is for some compromised on all sides, which Australia has managed well. 

We see all around the world how authoritarian governments try to prevent multiculturalism, but all they're doing is slowing the inevitable. 

> [planespherev3](#comment_253_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): Multiculturalism is cool, until it isn't, ... (saving data, I cut it out)

Which is why the law should always be equal, regardless of where you are from, what race you are, what gender you are, what sexuality you are and so on. If you break the law, you should be punished under the law. That is what happens in Australia, and I'd expect in the rest of the world too.

> [planespherev3](#comment_253_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): This is multiculturalism.

I disagree, Australian multiculturalism is pretty nice. Come down some time, look around. Enjoy our diverse culture.

> [planespherev3](#comment_253_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): Time to kill cultural leftism once and for all.

Ah, a hypocrite. You're obviously against violence, but only when it suits your agenda. It's perfectly fine to be violent when it suits you, huh?

> [cosmologica](#comment_69_1PiXrhT1UjMZmJc5WFhfUxourdfapeHJ8o): What they want is not a multi cultural society, but a mono cultural society. With only one culture and one set of values.

I guess this is where Australia and the EU differ. We allow for multiple cultures to mix together, not force just one culture onto all. What we don't allow, though, is for people (of any culture) to break the law.

> [planespherev3](#comment_254_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): all should use it to live where they are supposed to

And you're the one who decides this? How does a race define a point on this planet where you can live? With this logic, where does someone who is mixed-race live, then?

> [planespherev3](#comment_254_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): Cultural leftism causes pain for millions of people.

But forcing people to live in certain places doesn't cause pain, yeah? What about people of different backgrounds who are one family? Are you going to separate them due to their backgrounds?

> [theanswerer0](#comment_1_1F2ZbgkHvpknveTB6wFa5xNEQBb8yxQnCR): 

All these examples you've shown are minority incidences and are rare in Australia. As with the gangs, they're not exclusive to people of one background. It's not all doom and gloom like you make out.

> [planespherev3](#comment_255_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): Those who are really integrated, could stay. [...]

And how do you tell who is and isn't fully integrated? Who's the one to decide that?

> [planespherev3](#comment_255_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): I don't see why making muslims live in arabs muslims countries or making africans living in africa should cause them pain. [...]

So you ignore any connections they may have to where they live, huh? Believe it or not, we're all human and we get attached to things. They may have friends, family and so fourth in their new place where they live. They may no longer feel like they belong in the place where you would want them to go back.


> [planespherev3](#comment_255_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): you care more about their destiny than your own. That is a part of cultural leftism.

In a way, yes. I want to ensure that everyone, regardless of their background, gets a fair go. We're all human and should be treated as such.

> [planespherev3](#comment_256_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): 

So you list a few minority issues and then blanket blame everyone? Of course we'll get violence from people of any background, it's in our human nature.

> [theanswerer0](#comment_2_1F2ZbgkHvpknveTB6wFa5xNEQBb8yxQnCR):  If we sent most brown people [...] away from white people, violent crime rates in western nations would plummet. Racial tension would plummet. TAX RATES would plummet. Never mind the other economic benefits.

Australia already has a low crime rate, we don't have many racial tensions, we're a semi-socialist country, so we like paying taxes as it provides for our public services such as universal healthcare, Centrelink and so on. Removing chunk of our population would only harm us economically. All the issues you've stated can be solved via an increase in education and standard of living. Once you educate a person, they're set for life and are able to give back to the economy.

> [theanswerer0](#comment_2_1F2ZbgkHvpknveTB6wFa5xNEQBb8yxQnCR): they drain us of resources at mind boggling rates

Maybe you just have an inefficient country? There's nothing special about one race. We're all the same.

> [theanswerer0](#comment_2_1F2ZbgkHvpknveTB6wFa5xNEQBb8yxQnCR): They create incredible pollution [...] noise pollution too

Again, this can be solved via an increase in education and standard of living. I see the way many countries are going, which is towards neo-liberalism. It's goal is to conquer and divide the community while collecting the profits. You're fighting the wrong battle here.  

> [theanswerer0](#comment_2_1F2ZbgkHvpknveTB6wFa5xNEQBb8yxQnCR): One of the worst parts of this is that the entire educational system in many white countries has been dumbed down to accommodate the average mental abilities and behavior of non-whites.

There is no proof that one race is inherently smarter than another. All it takes is for dedication.

> [planespherev3](#comment_258_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): 

Oh my! When someone who isn't white does something violent, you say: "They should all go back to where they come from! Leave us white people alone!" But when a white person does something violent, you say: "It's just bullying, nothing more." You are extremely bias towards your own culture.

> [planespherev3](#comment_260_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): 

I find it interesting how you keep referring to minority issues, then paining a whole group based on those issues, even though the majority of said group are not responsible for it.

You keep saying x place is capable of hosting x group of people, but that doesn't matter! Australia can host the entire planet's population, but that doesn't mean people would want to come here. 

As with your bottom statement, when you say social justice "warriors" are not liked around the world, I disagree. We have the Murdoch press in Australia painting all sorts of lies in an attempt to prevent progress, yet we still managed to get 6,087,965 people to preference Labor and the Greens first (many more parties push for social justice, and they've preferences Labor and the Greens, but they weren't first preferences). They are parties that strongly push for social justice.

P.S. I recommend you to read 'Free Software, Free Society' by Richard Stallman.

1513344544_1NekEfk2dRHtSeioUKrRXKfaiS9A6.body:
